intro: Echinocereus reichenbachii var. fitchii, commonly known as the Fitch's hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a columnar cactus with a distinctive appearance, featuring a spiny, ribbed stem that can grow up to 3 meters in height. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are typically borne at the base of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. This variety is known for its hardiness and ability to store water in its thick, fleshy stems.
